name: LFO
description:
'''LFO''' was a British [[electronic music]] act formed in 1988 consisting of [[Mark Bell (British musician)|Mark Bell]] and [[Gez Varley]]. They released their acclaimed debut LP ''[[Frequencies (album)|Frequencies]]'' in 1991 on Sheffield label [[Warp (record label)|Warp]]. After Varley left the group in 1996, Bell continued solo to release ''[[Advance (album)|Advance]]'' (1996) and ''[[Sheath (album)|Sheath]]'' (2003). Bell died in October 2014, ending the project. 

LFO are considered to be pioneers of the bass-heavy "[[bleep techno]]" style. [[AllMusic]] called them "one of British [[techno]]'s most important, agenda-setting groups."
